Q: Is g++ right when it accepts a C++ template struct having a member with a wrong default initializer? A:

Looks like a clang bug. pointer{} should be ignored when : pointer(nullptr) is in the member initializer list. If you leave pointer, then the code compiles.

Q: How to g++ a C++ program using boost/asio.hpp file? A:

g++ -std=c++11 -pthread sync_client.cpp -o sync_client

Then run program

./sync_client

Q: How do I convert userdata to a uint32 or float? A:

Function to convert userdata to float. Some userdata automatically converts to numbers so a case for that is included. Hopefully this still helps after 14 years!

function to_float(user_data)
    if type(user_data) == 'number' then
        float_string = string.format("%.1f", user_data)
        print('no convert')
    else
        local user_number = user_data:tonumber()
        float_string = string.format("%.1f", user_number)
    end 
    local my_float = tonumber(float_string)
    return my_float
